content.question: The derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x equals, negative 3 x plus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f of negative 1, equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an equation of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, negative 3 x plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, negative 3 x plus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
